subject: Made provision for glance service to use Launcher

Patch Set 2:

recheck no bug

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks.

Quick query: Is the addition of _get_response_from_http_request() just a convenience function or intrinsically required for this patch? If it's an optional extra (not linked to switching to Launcher) it would be great to remove it/put in as a separate patch (a larger number of smaller patches make reviewers' lives a little easier). Thanks.

Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Hi Stuart,

we have found out that some of the tests were failing because 'greenthreads' are not released back to the eventlet green pool (client socket connection is not closed) due to which the glance api service doesn't shutdown gracefully.

To address this issue, we have separated out the request call in _get_response_from_http_request() method, so that after the execution of that method the object should be garbage collected automatically.

Patch Set 8:

Just some further thoughts...

If I start up the glance api (with this patch), eg with:

$.tox/py27/bin/python -m glance.cmd.api --config-file /etc/glance/glance-api.conf

Then run the following client script to connect:

 import httplib2
 import time

 path = 'http://%s:%d' % ('127.0.0.1', 9292)
 http = httplib2.Http()
 response, content = http.request(path, 'GET')

 time.sleep(1000000)

And then do

$ kill -HUP <parent_process_id>

The server waits indefinitely:

 2014-08-29 13:58:46.629 20381 INFO glance.openstack.common.service [-] Caught SIGHUP, stopping children
 2014-08-29 13:58:46.629 20381 INFO glance.openstack.common.service [-] Waiting on 1 children to exit
 2014-08-29 13:58:46.629 20389 INFO glance.openstack.common.service [-] Child caught SIGTERM, exiting
 2014-08-29 13:58:46.630 20389 INFO glance.wsgi.server [-] Stopping WSGI server.

It's only when I kill the client script that the server exits:

 2014-08-29 13:59:34.691 20389 INFO glance.wsgi.server [-] WSGI server has stopped.
 2014-08-29 13:59:34.693 20381 INFO glance.openstack.common.service [-] Child 20389 exited with status 1

We probably need to think about the behaviour we want here. Does it really make sense for a single open
client connection to prevent the server restarting indefinitely?

I tried the above with cinder and the server seemed to exit straight away.

For comparison this is what swift does:

 http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/admin_guide.html#swift-orphans

Patch Set 8:

Stuart:
You are right, because in cinder it doesn't wait until all requests are processed completely. If you call _server.wait after _server.kill is called , then it raises GreenletExit exception, it doesn't wait until the requests in hand are processed completely.

The intention of this patch is to process all requests that are in hand (it won't accepts new requests) before restarting it again to give nice experience to the users. Take an example of user downloading or uploading big image and in between administrator restarts the service. It might be frustrating for the user to repeat the same action again.
